The Bull Cutter Link: https://bullcutter.blogspot.com/

These are short common sense opinions on today's (and yesterday's) news to counter the bulldroppings fed you by the liberal media. Sometimes I don't have URLs to news items, but I will give them to you when I can. Publishers are encouraged to use items from this blog by simply retaining my copyright indicia. Please let me know at raythomas101@yahoo.com when you do.

Friday, June 9, 2017

Assassination Of Kim Jong Un

Kim seems to think the U. S. conspired with S. Korea to assassinate him. La Te Dah! So the hell WHAT? I don't think there's anybody right now who RATES assassination more than he does. But frankly, if Trump wanted to get rid of this pot-bellied cartoon dictator and all his cartoon generals with their medals reaching down to their knees, he'd just send a MOAB bomb to explode over wherever he is that day. I'm sure they're keeping track of his movements and location at all times. But again, quite frankly, I think assassination would be am much better way of dealing with this fool, as it would kill a lot fewer of his citizens” than would an airstrike. He's certainly doing everything he can to EARN an assassination, but he's really not important enough to bother. I'm surprised somebody else hasn't assassinated him, already. Maybe a relative of one of the cartoon generals he has murdered. (Fox News) Link: http://www.foxnews.com/world/2017/05/05/north-korea-accuses-us-south-korea-kim-jong-un-assassination-plot.html

Posted by Ray Thomas Link: https://draft.blogger.com/profile/00092446065733406225 at 3:18 PM Link: https://bullcutter.blogspot.com/2017/06/assassination-of-kim-jong-un.html

Liberal Stupidity

PEOPLE ARE STUPID!“We can’t afford to have that money go to the private sector. The money has to go to the federal government because the federal government will spend that money better than the private sector will spend it.”

-First Lady Hillary Clinton, in 1993.

Quotes of Note

A Revolution Before Nightfall

"I believe that if the people of this nation fully understood what Congress has done to them over the last 49 years, they would move on Washington; they would not wait for an election. It adds up to a preconceived plan to destroy the economic and social independence of the United States."

Former Senator from Nevada George Malone

Philosophy

People tell me this blog is about politics. It's not. It's about individualist philosophy vs. the subjectivist philosophy offered by liberals. But since you can't divorce politics from philosophy, I guess it's about politics, too.
